prompt: <description>Part 1: A curved rectangular prism Step 1: Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Step 3: Draw the curves and loops * Draw arc_1, starting at [0.0, 0.2625], with a midpoint at [0.0795, 0.2295], ending at [0.1125, 0.15]. * Draw line_1, starting at [0.1125, 0.15], ending at [0.1125, 0.0]. * Draw line_2, starting at [0.1125, 0.0], ending at [0.675, 0.0]. * Draw line_3, starting at [0.675, 0.0], ending at [0.675, 0.1125]. * Draw line_4, starting at [0.675, 0.1125], ending at [0.75, 0.1125]. * Draw line_5, starting at [0.75, 0.1125], ending at [0.75, 0.5625]. * Draw line_6, starting at [0.75, 0.5625], ending at [0.0, 0.5625]. * Draw line_7, starting at [0.0, 0.5625], ending at [0.0, 0.2625]. Each loop is always closed. In this case, there is a single loop comprised of arc_1, line_1, line_2, line_3, line_4, line_5, line_6, and line_7. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.0375 units (towards the positive Z direction), maintaining a constant cross-sectional shape by scaling the sketch by a factor of 0.75. This creates a new body with the given shape as determined by the "description" section. The resulting part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side, with a length of 0.0375 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.75 units.</description>
